text: Helmut Rauch (22 January 1939 - 2 September 2019) was an Austrian physicist. He was specially known for his experiments on neutron interference. He was born in Krems an der Donau, Lower Austria. In 1979, he became a member of the Austrian Academy of Sciences. In 1985, he was awarded the Wilhelm Exner Medal. In 1990, he was elected a member of the Academia Europaea. Rauch died on 2 September 2019 from a short-illness in Vienna at the age of 80. ==References== ==Other websites== * Wittgenstein-Preis f√ºr Helmut Rauch 7 October 2006 in ORF Wien (in German), last visited 25 April 2009 * Helmut Rauch on the Homepage of the Austrian Research Agency (in German), last visited 25 April 2009 Category:Austrian physicists Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:1939 births Category:2019 deaths
title: Helmut Rauch
